claim: the win team of this round be north melbourne , south melbourne , fitzroy , essendon , st kilda , and footscray
resp:
Here's the reasoning step-by-step:

1. Identify the teams listed in the table to understand who played on 7 June 1926. In this case, the teams are north melbourne, melbourne, fitzroy, geelong, st kilda, and footscray.

2. Compare the home team score with the away team score for each game. If the home team has a higher score than the away team, then the home team wins the match.

3. Apply this comparison for all games on 7 June 1926. In our table:
   - north melbourne (home) scored 73 and richmond (away) scored 74, so Richmond won this game.
   - Melbourne (home) scored 88 and south melbourne (away) scored 65, so Melbourne won this game.
   - fitzroy (home) scored 81 and hawthorn (away) scored 96, so Hawthorn won this game.
   - geelong (home) scored 89 and essendon (away) scored 51, so Geelong won this game.
   - st kilda (home) scored 66 and collingwood (away) scored 76, so Collingwood won this game.
   - footscray (home) scored 71 and carlton (away) scored 93, so Carlton won this game.

4. Since none of the home teams won their respective matches on 7 June 1926 according to our table, it means that the claim "the win team of this round be north melbourne, south melbourne, fitzroy, essendon, st kilda, and footscray" is FALSE.
